Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: stub67 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, great value, and a great location. The staff were great on arrival - we arrived at 9am but they still let us check-in and when we needed advice they were spot on with their recommendations. The rooms are spotless and whilst there is an element of no frills you get exactly what you need for a pleasant stay - a brilliant mattress ensured a lovely sleep. U-bahn and S-bahn stations are only 10 minutes walk away and the tram pulls-up in front of the hotel. I would use the hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a trip to Berlin and on a budget then I would heartily recommend this Etap. Only a five minute walk from Alexanderplatz station and with a tram stop directly outside this hotel is perfectly situated. The rooms sleep up to 3 and although basic are extremely comfortable and clean. I'm back in Berlin next month and I'm booked in here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: skaylong
Reviews.Content: Let's cut to the chase - this is NOT a luxury hotel. But if you are looking for cheap and clean accommodation in the heart of Berlin you can't go far wrong here. The room is basic with a double bed and a single over it - a bunk-bed in effect. There are hangers for your clothes (only a few so take some spares if you like to hang a lot of things up), a small desk, a mirror on the wall and a washbasin in the room. It's worth noting that the shower cubicle is also in the room (and although it's not entirely see-through, if you aren't on your own or with a partner - potentially you could feel a tad uncomfortable about showering with another person in the room). The toilet, although in the room, is behind a fixed door. Don't expect a room with a view. Mine overlooked a building site. But I don't recall any noise. The staff on Reception were fabulous - very smiley and helpful. Breakfast was served in the lobby and was very good and varied. Guests were mostly German - such friendly people! The area seems to be up and coming with a new restaurant opening downstairs (good for a quick/cheap eat before heading out on the town) and building work going on. Great transport links both outside the hotel and from Alexanderplatz (ten minute walk away). I can really recommend this hotel as a great base for exploring an amazing city that has something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located right in heart of city. Near to Alexanderplatz. Excellent connectivity through trams.Rooms are a bit cramped but utility wise very good. Breakfast is good and you can find tour offers and the maps in reception. Especially appreciate the fact we were given accommodation even though we checked in much earlier than the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good location and service with great value and nice breakfast, Also the room size ok and clean. The hotel is close to the famouse station in berline which has excellent conection to all attraction and the big shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Etap Alexanderplatz a good value”
Reviews.Author: Gee-in-the-Peg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Etap Hotel Berlin Alexanderplatz in September 2011 for one night. The hotel is not at the Alexanderplatz, but is an easy 15 minute walk down a main thoroughfare. The hotel is off on its own, not much nearby in terms of restaurants and shops, but there is a large grocery store/supermarket just behind the hotel. It has a bakery section with pastries so you can pick up some food to go here. The hotel check in was very efficient, staff friendly. First impressions were that the hotel was better than I imagined it would be for $60 per night. Once up to the room, I continued to be impressed. The place was spotless - room, hallways, reception area. The room itself is quite spartan (think Ikea display room), but it was adequate. It had a queen sized bed, with a single bed over top (bunkbed style). The room had a small desk, with a wall mounted flat screen TV above it. Satellite service brought quite a few English channels, not just the repetitive English language news-only channels that I have experienced at other Berlin hotels. The Bathroom is a bit strange, but functional. The shower/toilet/sink are all one plastic/fibreglas unit. The shower glass door opens inward, and you step out of the shower right into the room. This was fine for me as I was staying alone, but might be a bit odd if you were sharing the room with a fellow work traveller, or older children. the toilet is in a separate room - more like a closet, and the sink is attached to the outside wall of this room. Not much for counter space to put your toiletries. Lighting in the room was well done, with a cool string of LED lights mid way up the wall and around the room. There were overhead lights, and reading lights above the bed, as well. The room is quite cleverly thought out, with very good use of the small space to make it functional. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast, which I did not have, for 10 Euros. It looked to me like it was mostly cold items (cereal, breads), but I didn't stay for breakfast and so cannot be sure. As mentioned, there is a grocery store behind the hotel that sells pastries and coffee for a reasonable price. For the price, I was very happy with the room and hotel, and would definitely recommend staying here for the budget conscious person who wants a clean, safe, and quiet place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: KitKat9020
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the shower was very good. The hotel is located just north of Alexanderplatz but a 5 min tram journey takes you to the train station at Alexanderplatz. Highly recommend getting a Berlin welcome card as well worth the money if you want to see things all around the city. There is always someone on reception and they were happy to help if we had any questions. The breakfast was an extra 6 Euros I think but was very good and is available for a long-time so you don't have to plan your day around when breakfast is. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Standard, clean, just for stay”
Reviews.Author: conf-traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheap, clean and standard 2-3 star hotel. The location is very good, i.e, at the center of Eastern Berlin and very close to Museum island and close to other must-to-see places. You can eat a good breakfast for 6 euros. But that's it! Do not expect another think, but you won't get suprise... (Important note especially for ladies, there is no hair dryer in the rooms!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Hotel staff friendly and helped when needed. Rooms clean and tidy. Hotel 5 min walk from trams, S-Bahn and U-Bahn. Free internet access which was useful and staff would print things out for you if needed free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was very fine or almost only the hotel is not at Alexanderplatz but 15 minutes of walk away from, which can complicate several days stay with kids... Otherwise no complaints, the hotel is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Value for Money. Close to city center and Alexander Platz. hotel is clean. Rooms is designed in smart way to utilize the space. shower doesn't have shower gel. there is only soap. it is minor thing.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Do not live in a city I live in a town
Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a lower priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2years old.It is modern and gives excellent value service in all its facillities for B & B plus out of hours cabinet machine for hot and cold drinks and snacks. It is situated in a safe and well lit area to the east of Berlin ,has both bus and Trolly bus services within 50 yards of the building, to all areas of Berlin including the main railway station at the Alexander Platz which is about 10 minets walking distance. It is central for shopping malls entertainment ,theatres and the tourist trail ie, Fernsetum, Brandenberg Gate etc. and within 5 mins walk to a beautiful Park in Friederischain.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location and quality of the hotel were as promised in the description. I would not hesitate to go there again or recommend it to a friend. This is really at the center of Berlin, that's where you want to be as a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel had an ideal location. The room got what it need - nothing more nothing less and we needed a bed, toilet and bath because we just had to sleep there. And it very was affordable. Next time we will also use that hotel if the purpose of our stay is the sa

Reviews.Title: “very nice Etap”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stay in Berlin for 5 days and the hotel it's in good position (5 min by foot from Alexanderplatz and 2 min. with bus). Rooms are very clean and very modern conception, with SAT-TV, but not the italian one... :-) You can keep your car into a reserved garage in FREE I like very much position near TV Tower in Alexanderplatz Thanks for all !

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Indie83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic but the room was very clean and spacious. We had to buy hand soap etc, but that's to be expected with an Etap. The bed was big enough but as hard as a rock- on further inspection, we noticed it was just a mattress sitting on top of a thin piece of chipboard! However, we didn't notice it after the second day as we were both exhausted from walking around the city. There is a TV in the room and a desk. The shower in the wall was unusual but it was clean and had a strong beam and was really all we really needed. The wifi in the hotel was very good and was free. We skipped breakfast at the hotel and instead grabbed some pastries on our way at a small bakery across from the hotel. The hotel is just a 8-10 minute walk to the main area of Alexanderplatz. The immediate area around the hotel is nothing to write home about. It's surrounded by old, bland concrete apartment blocks, which some appeared to be derelict. A busy road junction is the only sense of life around. However, the main centre of Alex has plenty of transport links and shopping. I'm not sure if we would return to this particular Etap. Potsdamer seemed to be a more lively area and if we were to go back to Berlin we would stay at the Etap there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: DP301
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic, no frills - uncarpeted, double bed with a single loft if you want to fit 3 people or have a child with you, small bathroom, free internet. Everything is very clean and comfortable. For a budget hotel this is a very good deal - I think we paid €69 for two people. Room prices start at €59 with €10 for each additional person staying in the room. The location is also convenient. There isn't much going on right where the hotel is, but it's in a safe location and within short (5 minutes) walking distance of Alexanderplatz. I would recommend this hotel for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep and great breakfast with yummy sausages”
Reviews.Author: sarkarosso
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under renovation or construction during October 2010. The breakfast at Euro 6.00 was great. The only place in continental Europe where we found that the breakfast included sausages. The staff knew English and were very helpful. The locality is quiet even during the peak day traffic. The quality of sleep was excellent. The location is well connected and I am going back there during my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Kjelvi
Reviews.Content: Had two nights in connection with a weekend trip to Berlin. A basic hotel with no luxury, but a bargain compared to the cost. 3 mins by tram/10 mins walk from Alexanderplatz, with all its possibilities. The only negative was the wireless internet; free, but terribly slow! Polite staff who spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: seat_1A_traveller
Reviews.Content: The Etap Berlin Alexanderplatz is a 5 minute tram journey from Alexanderplatz (for connecting U & S Bahn trains and trains to/from Shoenfelde airport) Rooms are basic but clean and well maintained; comfortable bed, desk with chair, mirror, small area to hang clothes, sink, shower cubicle and toilet. I had a room on the right corner and had a beautiful view of the TV tower. Rooms have satalite television with a selction of German speaking channels such as RTL, Sat1, etc. There are no English speaking channels such as BBC World, Sky News or CNN. Windows are double glazed. Breakfast is good, with a good selection of ceriels, cheese, breads, yogurts, fruit, coffee and tea. Staff are friendly and speak English. Check-in is efficient and friendly and check out is just as quick and friendly. Free wifi internet is available in guest rooms and public areas. The hotel is not near Under Den Linden or the Brandenburg Gate or the government district but the Etap Berlin Alexanderplatz is great for exploring Alexanderplatz and using it as a base and using Berlin's excellent public transport network.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: webster5575
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a group of lads on a weekend city tour. This was a good base. The rooms were v.clean, comfortable and v.good value. Nothing to complain about at all. Good base for the sights of Berlin. The nightlife is out of this world!!! If you like mainstream clubbing try Adagio life, amazing location a bit like a huge ball room but ultra trendy with great tunes open til 6am. If you are into techno then we stumbled by chance across 'TRESOR'. Simply put the most dramatic and amazing club i have ever been in. If you have seen the film Blade then this is it! No vampires or blood but you strangely expect it! Set in an old industrial power station their is a basement room which is very underground. Dark as hell with manic strobe lighting and techno base tunes that literally shake your organs. We got there at 5.30am and left at 9am with loads of people still in there. The place is scary and completely crazy but if you like your beats then this place is just amazing. Search club tresor berlin and check out the pics! Berlin is an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: magnata602
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great value , location, service! It is next of subway and shoppings in berlin.

Reviews.Title: “central location, very clean & comfortable, free internet & WiFi.”
Reviews.Author: iJustDoEyes
Reviews.Content: It's an easy walk of 10mins to Alexanderplatz. - take Otto Braun strasse and it's at the bottom. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean and staff at the desk have fluent English. My room was a decent size, had a desk & chair & tv. & free WiFi (there's internet in the foyer). The shower was great - very powerful, the bed was a good size and firm. The main street out front is very busy with traffic but the windows have good double glazing and there is air con in the room. I'm a light sleeper and the noise didn't bother me. I've stayed in plenty of hotels at twice the price of this one that couldn't match it for value for money and cleanliness. As a female solo traveller I felt safe in the surrounding area. Tips - Alexanderplatz is not attractive but is a great central point for exploring by foot or public transport. It's next to the Fernsehturm so you'll never forget how to find your way back. What I did walking in 1 day: 5mins down the street from the 'Turm is the pretty area of Nicholai Viertal beside the river. Worth a wander around & a large breakfast, then hop on the U bahn at Klosterstrasse to Stadmitte to see Checkpoint Charlie & the interesting Wall Museum. Walk round the old line of the Wall past Potsdamerplatz and stroll up the road to experience the impresssive Monument to the Murdered Jews and the Brandenburg Gate & the Reichstag for a wee sit down on the grass. Then walk under the gate and up to Museum Island and sit by the river to have a late lunch. You can then walk up to the Hackescher market & the Hackescher Hofe to wander round the pretty cobbled courtyards, eat & drink & shop. There are of course lots of other things on this circuit so it depends what you like. I enjoyed the architecture but didn't go into any of the museums or galleries - that's for next time. I spent 9 hours but didn't rush and stopped for lots of coffee and food along the way. I went out at night to the area of Kreuzberg where there are lots of pubs open late. Stick to the main streets here and it's a great area to go out for drinks. A taxi back from here costs about Euro12-15. I took a Rough Guide and was struck by how negative it was about many things. Berlin is easy to wander round by foot and there were great places I would have missed if I hadn't already had 'insider information' from a friend. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms,Comfy Hotel,Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Topika
Reviews.Content: Before I came to this hotel,I thought it was in the middle of nowhere but in contrast it was right in the middle of the city center. The staff was friendly. Hadnt had the breakfast but it was not very rich,no need to pay 6 € each. The room was small but convenient. The thing is there is a child bed above the head of your parent bed so watch out not to hurt yourself as I bumbed my head a couple of times when in and out of bed. There is a tram going to alexanderplatz right in front of the hotel,M 4-5-6 goes to city center and U-S Bahn if you want to go somewhere else like Kurfurstendamm or somewhere else. We did not take the tram most ıf the times and just walked to the city center as it was nothing more than 10 mins.(We made it when there was snow all about so maybe less without the snow boots)Finally cheap stay,nice location,do not need to pay more if you go Berlin,stay in Etap Hotel Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: rustypup1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early December 2010. Tram stop outside, easy to get to train station and Alexanderplatz. Having the bunk bed above is great for families with a young child. Many food places nearby. Behind the hotel carpark was a spanish type restaurant - good food and good price. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central hotel for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: kiwisinl0nd0n
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in central location. The hotel is new, clean, fresh. The beds are comfortable and the hotel is just far enough away from the centre to get quiet and a great nights sleep. Keyless entry for all rooms, as a code is all you need to enter yor room. The rooms are small, the shower is basically a cupboard, but it is great value for central Berlin. Everything you need is in the room. We didn't get breakfast, saw others eating pastries, tea coffee etc. IT is 6 Euros per person from the hotel, there is a supermarket with a bakery across the road and the same thing for two people is 4 Euros. Next time we are in Berlin we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great bed!”
Reviews.Author: saoirsechick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just a 5 minute walk from Alexanderplatz s+u bahn. Conveniently there is a Kaiser's supermarket just next door which has a bakery which also serves fresh coffee. The trams stop just outside the doors of the hotel, and within walking distance are plenty of bars and restaurants and lots of Turkish food places. The hotel itself is modern and spotlessly clean, and the rooms are comfortable and well equipped, with several English speaking channels on the flat screen tv. The double bed was large and really comfortable, and downstairs in the hotel reception they had vending machines with snacks and cold drinks. All in a fantastic place to stay, and fantastic value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Etap Hotel Berlin Alexanderplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Mollstrasse 30, 10249 Berlin, Germany
